meanings.definition: To move faster than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah can outspeed the turtle easily.
meanings.sent2: The race car was able to outspeed all the other vehicles on the track.
meanings.sent3: The snail challenged the rabbit to a race, hoping to outspeed it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to win helped her outspeed all her competitors.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to whisper to the runner, urging him to outspeed his own limits.

meanings.sent1: The new sports car can easily outspeed the old model.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained hard to outspeed his previous record.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise tried to outspeed the hare in the race, causing quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The spaceship was designed to outspeed any other spacecraft in the galaxy.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed swiftly, as if trying to outspeed the approaching storm.
